response.answer_text: The best way to learn Augmented Reality is to implement a project. Let us try and understand some basic aspects of Augmented Reality first and then let us delve into a working project. Definition of Augmented Reality Augmented reality (AR) is an interactive experience of a real-world environment where the objects that reside in the real-world are "augmented" by computer-generated perceptual information, sometimes across multiple sensory modalities, including visual, auditory, haptic, somatosensory, and olfactory. How does AR work? In simple words, AR deploys a virtual image by using computer vision and tracks it to a physical point in your live environment. Because of this tracking, when you move the camera around, (take it closer or further away) the object is able to sustain, scale and optimize its location in your view of the real world. The simplest form of tracking is achieved by a device through a combination of accelerometer and gyroscope in order to figure out your position automatically. There are applications that combine the power of GPS with AR to give a more realistic experience. Technical details of how AR work? When building your own Augmented Reality-based application, you’d be dealing with 2 things: Vuforia: In simple terms, Vuforia Engine is a software platform for creating Augmented Reality apps. Using Vuforia, developers can easily add advanced computer vision functionality to any application, allowing it to recognize images and objects, and interact with spaces in the real world.Unity: In simple terms, Unity is a cross-platform game engine. Unity gives users the ability to create games in both 2D and 3D.So, the key to learning Augmented Reality is to combine Vuforia with Unity. Let us see a great example of Augmented Reality in action.
